Text:
Any debate about 'God' that makes reference to the bible is flawed from the outset.

Quoting from fiction is no basis for valid argument.
re Quoting from fiction is no basis for valid argument, Yes I partly agree. The bible is partly fiction and partly non-fiction.
thanks for this great upload, an eye openern beyond religion!

Looks like another attempt to put God in a mould that the writer can relate to. Doesn't read like proper logic though.
Since time is a physical property, and God is outside the physical domain how can change be possible in God for a human observer who is bound by time? There is no "I am" or "I will be" for an entity outside the timedomain.
